column4: anyone know how to make gnome-terminal --tab-with-profile=foo actually work? it's supposed to put a new tab in an existing window, and it's broken
i always get a new window instead
wrong sysntax, try --tab-with-profile-internal-id=PROFILEID
http://pwet.fr/man/linux/commandes/gnome_terminal
ok, what should PROFILEID *be* then?
the name of the profile of terminal, you may need to view the settings to get the profile name
i don't think that does what you think it does
i dont use gnome-terminal but theres a man page for it and i couldnt see the option in there that you stated

--tab-with-profile is in fact an option, it just doesn't do what i thought it did (talking on ##gnome).  --tab-with-profile-internal-id is documented as being something the shell itself uses to do session management
i see
same ones i've always had.
compiz --replace doesn't affect my startup. this is a startup problem
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation GT200 [GeForce GTX 260M] (rev a2)
that isn't how i installed it. should i do that?
jockey-gtk was already installed
it is
ok! where do i set monitor refresh rate?
i'm not following. my video is fine.. i can even start compiz manually. it just isn't starting when the desktop comes up
i'm talking about the more typical situation where it's *not* in fstab.
usb partitions (you don't mount drives) can be equally in fstab
what would that look like in dmesg? i don't see any errors
as i said, that does not work for me
